Answer: First of all, it is important to note that cryptocurrency markets are 24/7.Second, you have to consider the different financial markets across the world and the differences in time there. United States, Asian Markets, and Europe all share different time zones and therefore different financial openings/closings and while the cryptocurrency markets do not close, the equities, commodities and futures markets do close.There is said recently to be a lag or catchup time for the crypto markets to catch up to the CME futures action as well especially early on in the business week as the cryptocurrencyFirst of all, it is important to note that cryptocurrency markets are 24/7.Second, you have to consider the different financial markets across the world and the differences in time there. United States, Asian Markets, and Europe all share different time zones and therefore different financial openings/closings and while the cryptocurrency markets do not close, the equities, commodities and futures markets do close.There is said recently to be a lag or catchup time for the crypto markets to catch up to the CME futures action as well especially early on in the business week as the cryptocurrency prices fluctuate (due to normal market conditions) over the weekends but futures markets are closed.
